page.title: 17THE TRACTION ENGINE RALLY
page.content: The rally is held at Low Burton Hall fields. These lie on the opposite side of the bridge and Holme and there is a natural grandstand on the hillside from which many events may be viewed. The rally is organised by the Town Hall Association to raise money for the upkeep of the Town Hall. Part of the money goes to charity. It is the rally's 21st year in July 1985. On Sunday as well as the traction engines there are vintage cars, parachute team, heavy horse team, pipe band and of course a Rally Queen. At the rally there are many different rides such as the big slide called the Helter Skelter, dodgem cars, swing boats and Golden Gallopers. There are many side stalls. Upwards of 2O,OOO people attend this rally on each of the days.
